bill_title: provide a license for certain small scale mechanized mining operations.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide a license for certain small scale mechanized mining operations. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 45-6B be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: An operator shall obtain a license to conduct small scale mechanized mining in accordance with the provisions of chapter 45-6. However, the operator may only: (1) Use a high banker, spiral pans, trommel, dredge, or other earth-moving equipment that has less than eight horsepower which is cable of processing a maximum of three cubic yards of material per day per person; (2) Use a dredge that has suction hose that is three inches or less in diameter and has less than eight horsepower; (3) Operate a dredge between June first and September first; (4) Use mechanized equipment, except a dredge, above the high water mark of a stream channel; and (5) Operate a dredge on the channel bottom. The dredge may not undercut the stream bank or disturb the shoreline vegetation. If the operator is licensed under chapter 45-6, such activities do not require permitting under chapter 45-6B. Section 2. That § 45-6B-71.1 be amended to read as follows: 45-6B-71.1. Any operator mining within one hundred feet of a lake or stream of this state without a permit issued pursuant to this chapter or without a license issued pursuant to chapter 45-6 is guilty of a Class 2 misdemeanor.
